fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars

Class CausalValue<Type>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.Value<Type>
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.CausalValue<Type>

  • public class CausalValue<Type>
extends Value<Type>
    The class CausalValue implements value holder for HIOA models that allows depending models to trigger a causal transition on models upon which it depends before execution its own internal transition.

    Description

    This class is meant to be used to implement simulation models which update their state in a lazy evaluation manner. It is particularly interesting when a HIOA model is implemented using deterministic equations which can be evaluated only when an, updated value is needed rather than regularly as models with differential equations.

    However, mixing in one model causal and internal transitions can be tricky, hence it is probably a good practice to either have a model that is evaluated by internal transitions only or by causal transitions only.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2020-11-30

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CausalValue(AtomicHIOA owner, Type initialValue)
      create a causal value instance for the given variable and the given owner with an initial value but without history.
      CausalValue(AtomicHIOA owner, Type initialValue, int historySize)
      create a causal value instance for the given variable and the given owner with an initial value computed at the given initial time and with the given history size.
      CausalValue(AtomicHIOA owner, VariableDescriptor descriptor, Type initialValue, Time initialTime, int historySize)
      create a value instance for the given variable and the given owner and the given variable descriptor with an initial value computed at the given initial time and with the given history size.

      • CausalValue

        public CausalValue(AtomicHIOA owner,
                   Type initialValue)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        create a causal value instance for the given variable and the given owner with an initial value but without history.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null
 pre     initialTime.getTimeUnit().equals(owner.getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(timeUnit))
 pre     historySize >= 0
 post    this.owner.equals(owner)
 post  v.equals(initialValue)
 post    time.equals(initialTime)
 post    Value.checkInvariant(this)
        Parameters:
        owner - model owning the variable.
        initialValue - the initial value has been computed/assigned.

        public CausalValue(AtomicHIOA owner,
                   VariableDescriptor descriptor,
                   Type initialValue,
                   Time initialTime,
                   int historySize)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        create a value instance for the given variable and the given owner and the given variable descriptor with an initial value computed at the given initial time and with the given history size.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null
 pre     descriptor != null
 pre     initialTime.getTimeUnit().equals(owner.getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(timeUnit))
 pre     historySize >= 0
 post    this.owner.equals(owner)
 post    this.descriptor.equals(descriptor)
 post  v.equals(initialValue)
 post    time.equals(initialTime)
 post    Value.checkInvariant(this)
        Parameters:
        owner - model owning the variable.
        descriptor - descriptor of the variable.
        initialValue - initial value of the variable.
        initialTime - the time at which the initial value has been computed/assigned.
        historySize - predefined size of the history.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> update(Time currentTime)
        give the possibility to the model which produces this value to update its state immediately.

        Contract

         pre    true            // no precondition.
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - simulated time at which the update is mandated.
        Returns:
        a scheduled future allowing to synchronise the caller with the end of the execution of this update.
